issue.body: fixed fetchLabelsRO() test in IssueTest, which failed because it violated the condition "repository should never be NULL"

issue.title: Issue 645. Gists.create doesn't allow specifying visibility bug fixed.

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
I've added 'visible' parameter to `Gists.create` and implementation in mock and real classes implemented `Gists`. I didn't know which value should be set in different usages of this method, so I kept all clients behavior as it was i.e. set visible=false(according to documentation this parameter is `false` by default). I think that developers of issues that were blocked by this now have possibility to set this parameter as they needed. 
Documentation: http://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#create-a-gist

issue.title: Gists.create doesn't allow specifying visibility

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body: The Gists.create instance method does not allow specifying of visibility, while the GitHub API does. Not only is this a missing feature, but it causes Rultor to fail when running the test cases for Gist creation/reading/deletion.

issue.title: RtReleaseAssets request is wrong

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
Request path is wrong in `RtReleaseAssets` constructor
Now it is:

```
        this.request = this.entry.uri()
            .path("/repos")
            .path(coords.user())
            .path(coords.repo())
            .path("/releases")
            .path(Integer.toString(release.number()))
            .path("/comments")
            .back();
```

But it should be:

```
        this.request = this.entry.uri()
            .path("/repos")
            .path(coords.user())
            .path(coords.repo())
            .path("/releases")
            .path(Integer.toString(release.number()))
            .path("/assets")
            .back();
```

Please, see http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/releases/#list-assets-for-a-release
for details
